intro: Didymoglossum pinnatinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pinnataceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive morphology with leafy shoots and a delicate, branching structure. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a pinnate venation pattern, which is characteristic of the species. Didymoglossum pinnatinervium plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
